alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 13 at 6:59PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, East Bay Hills and the Diablo Range, East Bay Interior Valleys, San Francisco, San Francisco Bay Shoreline and Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain will be possible through this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
